intro: Leucheria gracilis, commonly known as the slender leucheria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, opposite leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and horticultural collections.
